text.0: gladden the yearning gods o thou most youthful bring them o lord of seasons knowing seasons.
text.1: with all the priests celestial o agni best worshipper art thou of all invokers.
text.2: thine is the heralds thine the cleansers office thinker art thou wealthgiver true to order.
text.3: let us with svāhā offer up oblations and agni worthy god pay the gods worship.
text.4: to the gods pathway have we travelled ready to execute what work we may accomplish.
text.5: let agni for he knows complete the worship he is the priest let him fix rites and seasons.
text.6: when we most ignorant neglect the statutes of you o deities with whom is knowledge.
text.7: wise agni shall correct our faults and failings skilled to assign each god his fitting season.
text.8: when weak in mind of feeble understanding mortals bethink them not of sacrificing.
text.9: then shall the prudent and discerning agni worship the gods best worshipper in season.
text.10: because the father hath produced thee leader of all our solemn rites their brilliant banner.
text.11: so win by worship pleasant homes abounding in heroes and rich food to nourish all men.
text.12: thou whom the heaven and earth thou whom the waters and tvaṣṭar maker of fair things created.
text.13: well knowing all along the fathers pathway shine with resplendent light enkindled agni.
